title: Alumni | Singapore Institute of Technology
text_lines: Leather Crafting Workshop (December 2024) - Enjoy a variety of activities and enriching experiences through Alumni Leisure Network workshops!
Tennis Simulator (September 2024) - Try different types of sports and get fit with your fellow SITizens at dynamic sessions organised by the Alumni Sports Network!
Money Mastery for Young Adults (August 2024) - Learn how to navigate life after University, elevate your career and personal development  through the SIT Alumni Career Network talks and seminars!
Alumni Movie Night (September 2024) - Catch the latest blockbusters at an affordable price at Alumni Movie Night, including a delicious dinner and popcorn and drinks to enjoy with your movie!

CheerS ITâ€™s Thursday! (December 2024) - Relax and unwind after work over drinks and good food with your fellow SIT alumni at this quarterly chill session, and catch up with your previous professors from school!
Inter-Cluster Games (March 2024) - Get competitive and test your skills with fellow SITizens at the annual Inter-Cluster Games (ICG) in a variety of sports!
Share experiences, learn from your juniors, and expand your professional circle as an Alumni Mentor through the SIT Alumni Mentoring Programme.
OSE (Alumni) SITizen Ambassador Retreat (March 2024) - Appreciation for our SAms who contribute to the success of SIT Alumni events.

Welcome to the SIT Alumni Family!

Hi SITizen! There are so many ways you can access exclusive lifelong privileges. Experience a variety of activities and pick up new skills catered to your personal and professional needs through the Career, Leisure and Sports Alumni Networks! Make new friends and build a community through Alumni Groups! Stay up to date â€“ download the SIT Alumni App!

Once a SITizen, Always a SITizen
Events, Updates, and more for SIT Alumni!

It was incredibly insightful when my mentor Jun Liang, invited a former mentee to one of our sessions. Hearing both of their experiences firsthand was brilliant because, as Eleanor Roosevelt said, â€˜Learn from the mistakes of others. You canâ€™t live long enough to make them all yourself.â€™ This session wasnâ€™t just advice; it felt like I got a fast-track look into potential paths and pitfalls, which has made me think much more strategically about my own future.

I was really grateful by how my mentor Shawn, went the extra mile to support me with an assignment. He actually reserved a room at his workplace so I could properly present my ideas and talk through the challenges in that formal setting. Getting his feedback in that professional setting was invaluable â€“ he pointed out things I hadnâ€™t considered and suggested concrete improvements that made a real difference to the projectâ€™s direction and my confidence in it.

The fact that my mentor Farhan, feels more like a friend than just a mentor is what I valued most. We have open conversations about everything â€“ from uni work and career ideas to just general life experiences. Itâ€™s this sharing of stories and experiences from a senior who had walked this path before, made the whole experience so memorable and really supportive. Itâ€™s not just about advice; itâ€™s about connection.

Being mentored by Bryan has been a game-changer, particularly with my job search. He didnâ€™t just give generic advice; he helped me properly focus my approach and, surprisingly, itâ€™s also shifted my general outlook on things. He has a knack for highlighting the crucial challenges I was grappling with â€“ some I hadnâ€™t even fully recognised â€“ and opened my eyes to new ways of thinking about my career and options.
Mechanical Design and Manufacturing Engineering, SIT â€“ NU

The SIT Badminton Alumni Group was established in 2024, with the support of the SIT Office of SITizen Experience (Alumni). Our mission is to create a vibrant community for badminton enthusiasts to connect, play, and enjoy the sport together.
Vice President â€“ Ng Hui Min

The SIT Cuesports Alumni Group was formed in March 2025, with the support of the SIT Office of SITIzen Experience (Alumni). This is a community for like-minded alumni who share a passion for billiards, snooker, and pool, serving as a platform for alumni to stay connected, engage in friendly matches, and continue honing their skills even after their university days. We aim to foster camaraderie among alumni through regular meetups, tournaments, and events.

Whether youâ€™re a casual player looking to relive the fun times at the tables or a dedicated competitor keen on keeping the spirit of the sport alive, come join us as we keep the passion for cuesports alive and build lasting connections beyond the campus!
Vice President â€“ Kwek Jia Rui
Secretary â€“ Bernard Saw Ming Guang

Established in January 2025 with the support of SIT Office of SITizen Experience (Alumni). SIT Archery Alumni Group welcomes all alumni who are enthusiastic about Archery or wish to connect with other Archers. SIT Archery Alumni Group is open to all regardless of experience!
President â€“ Tey Wei Xun Gary
Vice President â€“ Tan Yan Keng
Secretary â€“ See Toh Ming Kae

Established in 2020 with the support of the SIT Office of SITizen (Alumni), the SIT Ballroom Alumni Group was created as a platform for both experienced and aspiring dancers to pursue their passion for Ballroom dance across Standard, Latin, and Social disciplines. The group offers a vibrant space for alumni to reconnect, hone their skills, and explore new dance styles through regular classes, workshops, and social events.
SIT Air Transport Management Alumni Group

Established in 2022 with the support from the SIT Office of SITizen Experience (Alumni), ATM Alumni acts as a stepping stone for networking within the industry with the Industry Advisory Committee. More importantly, the group also acts as a bridge between the current student as well as the industry and also a way to keep everyone in touch.
SIT Digital Communications and Integrated Media Alumni Group

Founded in 2024 with the support of the SIT Office of SITizen Experience (Alumni), the SIT Digital Communications and Integrated Media Alumni Group is dedicated to establishing inter-connectedness among DCIM alumni. The group strives to open the doors for new opportunities by providing the necessary events, tools, and help for DCIM alumni.
Chairperson â€“ Goh Tian Hui Lionel
Vice-Chairperson â€“ Chevonne Law Yuen Yee
Treasurer â€“ Theodora Tan Li Shan

Founded in 2023 with the support of the SIT Office of SITizen Experience (Alumni), the SIT Hospitality Business Alumni Group is dedicated to creating lifelong intellectual, professional, and personal connections between alumni and their alma mater. At its core, the group endeavours to bridge the worlds of hospitality students, alumni, and industry professionals, forging lasting bonds and fostering collaboration within this dynamic field.
Vice-Chairman / Head of Administration â€“ Neo Hong Xuan
Head of Finance â€“ Nicholas Ong
Head of Social Media Marketing & Partnerships â€“ Skye Tan
Head of Operations & Logistics (Events) â€“ Samion Ong

The SIT Handball Alumni Group was formed in December 2022 with the support of the SIT Office of SITizen Experience (Alumni). This group serves as a platform for alumni to connect with one another through the joys of Handball, no matter your experience or background.

Established in 2022 with support from the SIT Office of SITizen Experience (Alumni), the SIT Running Alumni Group aims to build alumni through running and social events. They also aim to act as a bridge, connecting current students and alumni to keep in touch after graduation.

The SIT Tennis Alumni Group was founded in 2022 with the support of the SIT Office of SITizen Experience (Alumni). The group serves as a platform for tennis enthusiasts to connect with like-minded individuals to enjoy the sport together. All are welcome to join regardless of playing experience!

Founded in 2022 with the support of the SIT Office of SITizen Experience (Alumni), the SIT GSA Alumni Group was established as a platform for current creatives to network and exchange ideas. More importantly to get in touch with creative agency to provide freelance projects for GSA gradates.
Vice Chair â€“ Gwee Jia Lin
Secretary â€“ Teo Yen Chuen Andrew

The SIT Muzeka Alumni Group was formed in April 2022 with the support of the SIT Office of SITizen Experience (Alumni). This group is a platform for alumni to express themselves through music and aims to provide a safe space for everyone to experience the joy of music-making, no matter your experience or musical background.

Alumni mentoring programme serves as a great opportunity to be connected with SIT family. I served as alumni mentor during cycles 2 &3. My student mentees were from the disciplines of physiotherapy, and criminology and security respectively. My expertise is in the fields of nursing and clinical research. However, through mentoring sessions, I learnt and appreciated the intersections between our disciplines. I enjoyed interdisciplinary mentoring as it allowed me to think of care plans from the perspectives of a physiotherapist for an example. Additionally, our interdisciplinary conversations emphasized the importance of collaborations and networking to maximise impact of health outcomes and educational research.
Assistant Professor, Hong Kong Metropolitan Universityâ€™s School

Every individualâ€™s experiences are unique, at least they were for me when I was a SITizen. The struggles, excitement, and aspirations for my future occupied my headspace. I believe my juniors might feel the same way as I did.
I am eternally grateful to those who illuminated my path, and I have decided that becoming a mentor is the most meaningful way to do the same for others.

Mentorship isnâ€™t a solo journey, it has also provided me with improvements and areas of growth on how to communicate with people, as well as methods to provide clearer guidance on what people want in their life and career. Iâ€™m glad to share that with some of my mentees, we have continued our mentorship journey post the SIT Mentorship Programme and allowed us to continue to grow as a person together. With experience in mentoring undergraduates, professionally, I am now more capable and able to guide and lead my team better.
Thanks SIT for the opportunity and would look forward to many more mentorship cycles to come.
Being a mentor taught me that mentorship is a mutual learning experience. While I shared insights, I gained fresh perspectives from my mentee, keeping me inspired and informed.
Professionally, the programme expanded my network and honed my leadership skills, while personally, it brought fulfilment witnessing the growth of my mentees and forming meaningful bonds.
Senior Medical Marketing Specialist, DKSH Singapore Pte Ltd

The SITizen Ambassadors Alumni Group serves as an extension of SITizen Ambassadors (SAMs), a vibrant community of dedicated students who proudly uphold SITâ€™s esteemed position as Singaporeâ€™s premier University of Applied Learning. Committed to making a meaningful difference, SAMs are passionate about fostering a positive impact within the broader SIT community. As an alumni group, they continue to carry forward their shared pride for SIT and actively contribute their expertise, experiences, and network to support current students, promote engagement, and strengthen the bond between past and present SITizens.

Founded by a group of enthusiastic civil engineering alumni from SIT in March 2022. The SIT Civil Engineering Alumni Group is to inspire loyalty and pride among alumni and friends by developing and enhancing their continued relationship within the industry and programme.
As civil engineers we build lives not just structures, letâ€™s strive towards building our future together! The dreamers and the doers
Vice Chair â€“ Chua Guan Feng
Secretary â€“ Eldrynn Trishan Tan Swee Yong
Treasurer â€“ Winnie Teu Bu Zhi

During my experience mentoring both my mentees, I was able to learn about their lives and how they dealt with their problems. I felt that it was an enriching experience for me as a mentor to be able to learn from them as well.
I highly recommend our current and future SIT Alumni to participate in this program simply because there is so much opportunity to learn both as a mentor and as a mentee.

â€œIâ€™ve always believed in giving back and mentoring youths. Itâ€™s my personal goal to dedicate my time to grow as a mentor this year and the SIT mentorship programme is a perfect platform that matches mentors to the pool of ambitious mentees.

It wasnâ€™t just the mentees who benefited from this programme, it was a two-way learning process as Iâ€™ve gained knowledge on the happenings around gen Zs and also discovered how I can contribute as a mentor.â€

Itâ€™s great how the relationship with my mentee has evolved into one where we can support each other. It is not just a one-way street where I share guidance and provide feedback, but I have also learned from them about how I can better myself.

I choose to mentor because I see it as social responsibility and hope to see SIT produce graduates who not only possess practical industry work skills but also be people-oriented leaders in this society.
